page.title: 14 Birds of the Estuary
page.content: The River Stour is an Estuary it has 30,000 birds on it. The{birds} are an important part of the{ecology} of the estuary feeding on the mudflats when the tide goes out. The River Stour is famous for its' {mute swans}but now they are not so common because there is not much grain thrown into the river by the maltings these days. There are many common birds like shellduck, mallard, teal and tufted duck. There are 2,000 brent geese which come from Siberia in the Winter. The most common bird is the dunlin. The estuary is very important for the {redshank}and there are 1,500-2,000 of them. The most common gull on the River Stour is the black headed gull. The most interesting bird to visit the estuary in 1985 was a spoonnbill.
